result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Grimaldi

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Attorney Carli A. McNeill in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua C Grimaldi in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Joshua C Grimaldi. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Heard w/ co-defendant case 21CF1578. Victim rights compliance. The Court will adjourn this matter for reasons set forth on the record. Court will set case with the third co-defendants case in November. Attorney Schwarz requests that DE's appearance be waived at the next hearing as it is just for scheduling purposes; Court grants request. DE's appearance is waived at the next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Schwarz.  Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. Attorney Schwarz states they are at a holding point until an attorney can be appointed for co-defendant 21CF1578. STC set to 10/12/22 at 3:00

Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Watson and Atty Schwarz.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Schwarz advises they are still working through discovery and need more time. STC set to 08/25/22 at 9:30.

Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill and Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant in custody by zoom w/ Attorney B Schwarz and Attorney K Watson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Schwarz states he received the discovery last week and there is a lot to review. PTC set for 5/31/22 at 3:30pm. Bond continued.

Defendant Joshua C Grimaldi appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

122PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Victim T.T.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 17, 2022 at 09:00 am. $1000000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
